fr:mainmatter.html:p: We say a poset X is image finite, if for all x\in X, the upset \uparrow x is finite. We view X as a topological space via Alexandroff topology.

fr:title.text: Image finite posets are locally spectral

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Image finite posets are locally spectral

fr:mainmatter.html:p: For X an image finite poset with Alexandroff topology, it is a locally spectral space.

In the Alexandroff topology, opens are exactly upward closed sets. Hence, compact opens are exactly finitely generated, hence finite by being image finite, upsets. They evidently form a basis, and are closed under intersections.
Let X be an image finite poset. Recall from Lemma that as a topological space it is locally spectral. It is a scheme.

fr:tree.fr:mainmatter: We need to define a structural sheaf on X. For any upward closed susbet U of X, we define \mathcal {O}_{X}(U) := \mathcal {U}(U), the distributive lattice of upward closed subsets of U. This is a sheaf, because if we have a union U = \bigcup _{i\in I}U_i with an element V_i \in \mathcal {O}_{X}(U_i), which is V_i \subseteq U_i upward closed, which agrees on intersections, V_i \cap U_j = V_j \cap U_i, then there is a unique V \subseteq U given by V = \bigcup _{i\in I}V_i, such that V \cap U_j = \bigcup _{i\in I}V_i \cap U_j = \bigcup _{i\in I}V_j \cap U_i = V_j \cap \bigcup _{i\in I}U_i = V_j \cap U = V_j. This is in fact a locally distributed space, because for any x\in X, \mathcal {O}_{X,x} \cong \mathcal {O}_{X}(\uparrow x) \cong \mathcal {U}(\uparrow x), which is local because \uparrow x has a root (cf. Remark ). Finally, this is a scheme, because by construction for any x\in X, the open neighbourhood \uparrow x is affine (\uparrow x,\mathcal {O}_{\uparrow x}) \cong \operatorname {Spec}\mathcal {U}(\uparrow x).

fr:mainmatter.html:p: In fact, we can compute the global section of \operatorname {Spec}\mathbb {H}[x]_+. Under Proposition , it as an open subset corresponds to the maximal ideal M = \mathbb {H}[x]-\{1\}. This way under Proposition , \Gamma \mathcal {O}_{\operatorname {Spec}\mathbb {H}[x]_+} \cong \mathbb {H}[x]_M \cong \mathbb {H}[x]. The final isomorphism is an easy exercise. This means the open immersion \operatorname {Spec}\mathbb {H}[x]_+ \hookrightarrow \operatorname {Spec}\mathbb {H}[x] induces an isomorphism on global section.
